org.jtrim.event

Interface TrackedListenerManager<ArgType>

  • Type Parameters:
    ArgType - the type of the event argument which is to be passed to the onEvent method
    All Superinterfaces:
    ListenerRegistry<TrackedEventListener<ArgType>>, SimpleListenerRegistry<TrackedEventListener<ArgType>>

    public interface TrackedListenerManager<ArgType>
extends ListenerRegistry<TrackedEventListener<ArgType>>
    Defines a ListenerRegistry which allows events to be dispatched to registered listeners directly and the TrackedListenerManager will supply the causes of the events for the listener.

    This interface is similar to ListenerManager but will also specify the cause of the event for the registered listeners. In the usual case, an EventTracker keeps track of the causes of the events and provides the TrackedListenerManager instances.

    Thread safety

    Implementations of this interface are required to be safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The onEvent method of this interface does not required to be synchronization transparent but methods inherited from ListenerRegistry are required to be synchronization transparent as specified by ListenerRegistry.
    See Also:
    EventTracker, ListenerManager, TrackedEvent, TrackedEventListener

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onEvent(ArgType arg)
      Invokes the onEvent method of the registered TrackedEventListener instances.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jtrim.event.ListenerRegistry

        getListenerCount, registerListener

    • Method Detail

      • onEvent

        void onEvent(ArgType arg)
        Invokes the onEvent method of the registered TrackedEventListener instances. The onEvent method is called synchronously in the current thread.

        Adding new listeners to this container will have no effect on the current call and the listeners being notified. That is, if a notified listener adds a new listener to this container, the newly added listener will not be notified in this call, only in subsequent onEvent calls.

        The order in which the listener are notified is undefined. Also note, that multiply added listener might be notified multiple times depending on the exact implementation.

        Note that usually it is required that event listeners be invoked in the order the events occur. This can easily be done when events can only occur on single thread (as they do in Swing). However, when events can occur on multiple threads concurrently they are likely to occur while holding a lock and listeners should be notified right away to be notified of the event to keep the order of events. Note that calling an event handler method while holding a lock is prone to dead-lock (and it is very likely to be possible since it is hard to reason about what listeners might do). In this case you should consider using a TaskScheduler to invoke the onEvent method.

        Parameters:
        arg - the event specific argument to be passed to the registered listeners. The causes will be supplied by this TrackedListenerManager. This argument can be null, if the listeners accept null arguments for this event.
